title: Undefined reference to `getauxval` in function `init_have_lse_atomics`  when compiling to nightly `aarch64-unknown-linux-musl`

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

### Code

I received this pull request, which caught a regression for `aarch64-unknown-linux-musl` when compiling for nightly. The same process works for stable and beta. I don't have a machine that can easily compile to this platform, so I can't reduce it at the moment: https://github.com/XAMPPRocky/rasn/pull/49

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: Works on stable and beta `1.56.0-beta.4 (e6e620e1c 2021-10-04)`

- https://github.com/XAMPPRocky/rasn/pull/49/checks?check_run_id=3827011175

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`: 1.57.0-nightly (0eabf25b9 2021-10-06)

- https://github.com/XAMPPRocky/rasn/pull/49/checks?check_run_id=3827012571

<!--
Did the compiler crash? If so, please provide a backtrace.
-->

### Backtrace

```
= note: /rust/lib/rustlib/aarch64-unknown-linux-musl/lib/libcompiler_builtins-cbf6a032efba8222.rlib(cpu_model.o): In function `init_have_lse_atomics':
          /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/compiler_builtins-0.1.49/./lib/builtins/cpu_model.c:786: undefined reference to `getauxval'
          collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
          
= help: some `extern` functions couldn't be found; some native libraries may need to be installed or have their path specified
= note: use the `-l` flag to specify native libraries to link
= note: use the `cargo:rustc-link-lib` directive to specify the native libraries to link with Cargo (see https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/build-scripts.html#cargorustc-link-libkindname)
```

<!--
If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-nightly -regression-untriaged
-->
